alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:59AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oktibbeha, southern Clay and central Lowndes Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pheba, or near Starkville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Muldrow around 310 AM CDT. West Point and Tibbee around 315 AM CDT. Waverly around 325 AM CDT. Columbus AFB and Kolola Springs around 330 AM CDT. Steens around 335 AM CDT. Caledonia around 340 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern Mississippi.
